result.execSummary:
The defendant Anne M. Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anne M. Schuster

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:39 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Anne M. Schuster in court with Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee.  There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 2: Disorderly Conduct Domestic Abuse. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty.

Court orders $50 fine plus costs and surcharges, provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Conditions:
Comply with Pretrial Monitoring in conjunction with CTC texting to ensure sobriety.
No abusive, threatening or violent contact with D.W.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.

Conditions:
Comply with Pretrial Monitoring in conjunction with CTC texting to ensure sobriety.
No abusive, threatening or violent contact with D.W.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.

to Modify Bond.
It is hereby ordered: The defendant's bond is modified to require compliance with pretrial monitoring in conjunction with CTC testing to ensure her sobriety, in exchange for the no contact condition being modified to no abusive, threatening or violent contact with DW.
The defendant will sign the modified bond at the Clerk of Court's Office within two business days. The defendant is then required to schedule CTC intake within 24 hours.

Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney
It is hereby ordered that Attorney Mandy Caffee is named attorney of record for the Defendant. Attorney Susan Meade is withdrawn as counsel.
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

Attorney Susan Meade at $100/hr.  Defendant shall reimburse Eau Claire County by making payments of $100 beginning 07/15/2022 and every 30 days thereafter.  Payment shall not exceed the full cost of representation.

Conditions:

Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
